events.description: The Reserve Bank of India kept its key repo rate unchanged at 5.25%.
A trade agreement reducing US tariffs on Indian imports from 50% to 18%.
Upcoming legislative session expected to influence currency movements.

facts.fact_text: The Indian rupee rose to approximately 90.2 per dollar.

evidences.evidence_text: The Indian rupee rose to around 90.2 per dollar, extending gains to its strongest level in over three weeks

facts.fact_text: The Reserve Bank of India maintained the repo rate at 5.25%.

evidences.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India kept its key repo rate unchanged at 5.25%, in line with expectations.

facts.fact_text: The US-India trade deal lowers tariffs on Indian imports to 18%.

evidences.evidence_text: US-India trade deal, which reduces US tariffs on Indian imports from nearly 50% to 18%

claims.claim_text: The rate hold indicates a softer outlook for inflation.
claims.author: Reserve Bank of India

evidences.evidence_text: The hold reflects confidence in a softer inflation outlook

claims.claim_text: Accommodative monetary conditions are expected to persist.
claims.author: null

evidences.evidence_text: reassures markets that accommodative conditions will persist

claims.claim_text: Rupee movements will depend on global risk sentiment and capital flows.
claims.author: Analysts

evidences.evidence_text: Analysts note that near-term movements will continue to hinge on global risk sentiment, capital flows, and clarity around trade deal implementation

evidence.evidence_text: Indian Rupee Hits Over 3-Week High on RBI Rate Hold
The currency also continues to receive support from residual optimism over the US-India trade deal
near-term movements will continue to hinge on global risk sentiment
The hold reflects confidence in a softer inflation outlook
